intro: Miliusa villosa, commonly known as the hairy miliusa, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically hairy or pubescent, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by fleshy, red berries. The botanical features of Miliusa villosa make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
